dcterms:creator: Y. Li
R. Yu
C. Shahabi
Y. Liu
dcterms:description: The Pems-Bay dataset was collected by the California Transportation Agencies (CalTrans) utilizing the Performance Measurement System (PeMS). The dataset is based on 325 Bay Area sensors collected from Jan 1st, 2017, to May 31st, 2017, in 5-minute intervals. Each data point contains information about the traffic density and a normalized time value.
dcterms:title: Pems-Bay

dcterms:creator: H. V. Jagadish
J. Gehrke
A. Labrinidis
Y. Papakonstantinou
J. M. Patel
R. Ramakrishnan
C. Shahabi
dcterms:description: METR-LA is a similar dataset as Pems-Bay. The containing data was collected from Los Angeles County Highway ring detectors from March 1st, 2012, to June 30th, 2012. In total, 207 sensors were used to collect traffic density data.
dcterms:title: METR-LA

dcterms:creator: L. Codec√°
R. Frank
S. Faye
T. Engel
dcterms:description: The LuST dataset is based on the Luxembourg SUMO Traffic scenario. This scenario is executed in the Simulation of Urban Mobility (SUMO) environment, where traffic counts for every 5 minutes of each street and the corresponding speeds are extracted. The dataset contains traffic density and speed for the Luxembourg simulation covering an entire day.
dcterms:title: LuST
